title: Define core data types (Grammar and Segment)
intent: Create lsysviz/types.py defining the Grammar and Segment data types that all subsequent modules will depend on.
forbidden: Do not modify any existing files
Do not add any behavior or logic beyond type definitions
acceptance_commands: python -c "from lsysviz.types import Grammar, Segment; g = Grammar(axiom='A', rules={'A': 'B'}); assert g.axiom == 'A'; assert g.rules == {'A': 'B'}; s = Segment(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0); assert s.x1 == 1.0"
notes: Use typing.NamedTuple for both types. Grammar has fields: axiom (str) and rules (dict[str, str]) where keys are single characters and values are replacement strings. Segment has fields: x0 (float), y0 (float), x1 (float), y1 (float) representing a line segment endpoint pair. No methods, no defaults, no validation â€” just plain immutable data containers.
